Questionnaires address unmet supportive care need health-related quality life breast cancer survivor may help doctor learn barrier cancer care link language , acculturation , knowledge diagnosis care , financial concern . Learning unmet need breast cancer patient may help increase quality life decrease healthcare utilization cost .
DOC.brief_title: Supportive Care Questionnaires Gathering Data Unmet Needs Health-Related Quality Life Latina Breast Cancer Survivors After Surgery , Chemotherapy , Radiation Therapy
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . To assess supportive care need preference breast cancer survivor Los Angeles County + University Southern California ( USC ) Medical Center ( LAC+USC ) . SECONDARY OBJECTIVES : I . To determine lifestyle-related challenge individual breast cancer treat LAC+USC . II . To determine communication healthcare delivery style need preference individual breast cancer treat LAC+USC . OUTLINE : Participants complete demographic questionnaire , Supportive Care Needs Survey ( SCNS ) -34 , 36-item Short Form Health Survey ( SF-36 ) , Lifestyle Needs Survey . Within 1 year completing questionnaire , participant may complete one-hour in-person one-on-one interview comprise question challenge experience cancer survivorship , health well-being , supportive care need .
DOC.criteria: Patients receive ongoing care , include routine followup , LAC+USC Diagnosis breast cancer Completed primary surgical treatment , chemotherapy , and/or radiation Ability understand willingness sign write informed consent Inability sign write informed consent complete questionnaires/surveys Diagnosis metastatic cancer
